before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3t","text":"Add 10 mL of absolute isopropanol to Wash solution 1, mix well and store at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cekm0","text":"Add 48 mL of absolute ethanol to Wash solution 2, mix well and store at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Tree of Life Genome Note Editor

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"flt1v","text":"This protocol describes the automated extraction of RNA from multiple different tissue samples intended for RNA-Seq using the MagMax™ mirVana total RNA isolation kit and the Thermo Fisher KingFisher™ Apex. This process is highly effective for the majority of taxonomic groups covered by the Tree of Life Programme, however, challenging samples include corals, jellyfish and annelids. The output of this protocol is a highly concentrated RNA extract which can be diluted and submitted for RNA-Seq on Illumina NovaSeq.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":134,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Tree of Life at the Wellcome Sanger Institute

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8t8qm","text":"All steps can be performed at room temperature unless stated otherwise.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":71}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7itb","text":"If samples are not going to proceed to sample lysis immediately, keep samples on dry ice to maintain temperature and prevent nucleic acid degradation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":150}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sqpp","text":"An experienced operator can expect to comfortably process up to 32 samples, with approximately 2 hours handling time over a start to finish period of 3 hours. This estimation excludes subsequent QC checks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":205}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tkpi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvl1","text":"Additional Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hhp7","text":"FluidX tubes are used throughout the Tree of Life programme in order to track samples, therefore rather than the microcentrifuge tubes which have been mentioned in this protocol for RNA storage, all routine RNA extracts are stored in FluidX tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":247}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdlq2","text":"Both the KingFisher™ Apex protocol script and the KFX.file have been made available for this protocol - the KFX.file requires ‘BindIx software for KingFisher Apex’ to allow the KingFisher™ Apex protocol to be viewed on a PC or laptop. Alternatively, the file can be transferred directly onto a KingFisher™ Apex instrument using a USB.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":334}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: RNA extraction,automated RNA extraction,magnetic beads,MagMax,mirVana,reference genome

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7javr","text":"Prepare the TURBO DNase solution as described below, and once made, store on wet ice: ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ueg","text":"  ComponentVolume per sample (µL)MagMAX TURBO DNase Buffer60Turbo DNase (stored in freezer)2.5","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":94}],"data":{}},{"key":"agtg7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["Component","Volume per sample (µL)"],"colWidths":["230","182.9943084716797"],"data":[["Turbo DNase (stored in freezer)","2.5"],["MagMAX TURBO DNase Buffer","60"]],"guid":"2BEF2C962F9611EE8DAB0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Turbo DNase (stored in freezer)","2.5"],["MagMAX TURBO DNase Buffer","60"]],"rowHeights":[31,38]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7bkok","text":"Prepare the Binding Beads Mix as described below, and once made, store on wet ice: ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fubp2","text":"  ComponentVolume per sample (µL)RNA binding beads12Lysis/binding enhancer (stored in freezer)12","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":96}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9e37","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"A"},"0_0":"","0_1":"","1":{"0":"_"},"1_0":"","1_1":"","2":{"0":"2"},"2_0":"","2_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["Component","Volume per sample (µL)"],"colWidths":["218","187.99147033691406"],"data":[["RNA binding beads","12"],["Lysis/binding enhancer (stored in freezer)","12"]],"guid":"7EE82F672F9611EE8DAB0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["RNA binding beads","12"],["Lysis/binding enhancer (stored in freezer)","12"]],"rowHeights":[47,59]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1f6ud","text":"Calculate the amount of lysis buffer required for the samples – 40 µL is required per 1 mg of tissue. 15 mg of sample is used for this protocol, so 600 µL per sample is required.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71al8","text":"Create sufficient lysis buffer for your samples:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rbb3","text":"  ComponentVolume per sample (µL)Lysis Buffer1000DTT0.7","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":55}],"data":{}},{"key":"7cn8u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":[" Component","Volume per sample (µL)"],"colWidths":["138","203"],"data":[["Lysis Buffer","1000"],["DTT","0.7"]],"guid":"29C30F2F2F9711EE8DAB0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Lysis Buffer","1000"],["DTT","0.7"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9c98j","text":"For samples that require powermashing, transfer 15 mg of tissue into a 1.5 mL BioMasher II tube and add 600 µL of lysis buffer. Disrupt sample in the lysis buffer using a PowerMasher II tissue disruptor and the BioMasher pestle, until no large pieces remain or sample cannot be disrupted further (for more detailed instructions regarding powermashing, please refer to the Sanger Tree of Life Sample Homogenisation: Powermash protocol).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1aqpi","text":"For samples that have been cryoprepped, transfer the 15 mg of cryoprepped tissue into a 2 mL microcentrifuge tube and add 600 µL of lysis buffer. Pipette mix to homogenise the cryoprepped tissue and lysis buffer.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b73ea","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds to 1 minute to allow samples to lyse. If samples will not immediately progress to Step 8, place samples on ice until ready to proceed.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8om2v","text":"Transfer 200 µL of each sample directly into individual wells of a Thermo Fisher KingFisher™ 1 mL 96-well deep-well plate.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cirf8","text":"Add 100 µL of isopropanol to each sample, seal the plate and shake at room temperature on a plate shaker for 2 minutes at 950 rpm.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"10nuo","text":"Add 20 µL of the prepared binding beads mix to each sample, re-seal the plate and mix at room temperature on a plate shaker for 5 minutes at 950 rpm.  ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4e9le","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9sb2d","text":"On the KingFisher™ Apex, select the protocol (details below in the KingFisher™ Apex RNA Extraction Protocol Script/attached KFX file in the Materials Section) on the protocols list and select using the play button.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ffoa","text":"Load the processing plates and the sample plate in the positions prompted by the instrument and then start the run. The full protocol will take approximately 50 minutes.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qa4e","text":"After 30 minutes, the protocol will pause and there will be a prompt to remove the DNase plate from the instrument, and add 50 µL of the rebinding buffer and 100 µL absolute isopropanol to each well containing sample as quickly as possible – do not premix these reagents and always add them separately to the wells.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ibon","text":"Load the DNAse plate back into the instrument and press run to resume the protocol.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gjke","text":"At the end of the run, remove the elution plate and store on ice.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tl5m","text":"Pipette the eluates into microcentrifuge tubes, perform the required QC, and then store eluates at ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bidki","text":"–80°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"55mj9","text":"Prepare the remaining processing plates for the KingFisher™ Apex protocol:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ale5s","text":"     Plate IDPlate PositionPlate typeReagent(s) requiredVolume per wellSample Plate1Deep-wellSample + isopropanol + binding beads mix200 µL sample + 100 µL isopropanol + 20 µL binding beads mixWash Plate 12Deep-wellWash solution 1150 µLWash Plate 23Deep-wellWash solution 1150 µLDNase Plate4Deep-wellTURBO DNase solution50 µLWash Plate 35Deep-wellWash solution 2150 µLWash Plate 46Deep-wellWash solution 2150 µLElution plate7Standard (200 µL)Elution buffer50 µLTip Comb8Deep-wellPlace a  tip comb in the plate","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":509}],"data":{}},{"key":"bdqi4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l1o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"C"},"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","0_4":"","1":{"0":"_"},"1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","1_4":"","2":{"0":"8"},"2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","2_4":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","3_4":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","4_4":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":"","5_4":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","6_2":"","6_3":"","6_4":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","7_2":"","7_3":"","7_4":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","8_2":"","8_3":"","B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_8":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_8":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_8":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"E_8":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["Plate ID","Plate position","Plate type","Reagents(s) required","Volume per well"],"colWidths":[100,100,100,"149","182"],"data":[["Sample Plate","1","Deep-well","Sample + isopropanol + binding beads mix","200 µL sample + 100 µL isopropanol + 20 µL binding beads mix"],["Wash Plate 1","2","Deep-well","Wash solution 1","150 µL"],["Wash Plate 2","3","Deep-well","Wash solution 1","150 µL"],["DNase Plate","4","Deep-well","TURBO DNase solution","50 µL"],["Wash Plate 3","5","Deep-well","Wash solution 2","150 µL"],["Wash Plate 4","6","Deep-well","Wash solution 2","150 µL"],["Elution plate","7","Standard (200 µL)","Elution buffer","50 µL"],["Tip Comb","8","Deep-well","Place a  tip comb in the plate",""]],"guid":"AF8BFF9F2F9811EE8DAB0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{"D_8":[2,1]},"printData":[["Sample Plate","1","Deep-well","Sample + isopropanol + binding beads mix","200 µL sample + 100 µL isopropanol + 20 µL binding beads mix"],["Wash Plate 1","2","Deep-well","Wash solution 1","150 µL"],["Wash Plate 2","3","Deep-well","Wash solution 1","150 µL"],["DNase Plate","4","Deep-well","TURBO DNase solution","50 µL"],["Wash Plate 3","5","Deep-well","Wash solution 2","150 µL"],["Wash Plate 4","6","Deep-well","Wash solution 2","150 µL"],["Elution {"blocks":[{"key":"cp52r","text":"Inspect the elution plates for any magnetic beads in the wells. In the rare instance of magnetic beads remaining in the eluate (possible in viscous samples), these samples will need to be transferred to a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube and placed on a magnetic rack. Allow around 5 minutes for the beads to migrate and take the clear eluate containing the RNA using a pipette tip.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"blvnk","text":"The operator must wear a lab coat, powder-free nitrile gloves and safety specs to perform the laboratory procedures in this protocol. Cotton glove liners are strongly recommended when handling the samples on dry ice.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":216}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mqhp","text":"Waste needs to be collected in a suitable container (e.g. plastic screw-top jar or Biobin) and disposed in accordance with local regulations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":141}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh5ur","text":"Liquid waste needs to be collected in a suitable container (e.g. glass screw-top jar) and disposed in accordance with local regulations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":136}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45fid","text":"Do not open the door of the KingFisher™ Apex instrument whilst it is in operation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":82}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
